content:
Penn State infielder Landon Nakata  helps complete a double play during the Lions  victory over Duquesne at Beaver Field yesterday afternoon PERIOD

Advertisement

Fans left Beaver Field early yesterday PERIOD Not because they were unhappy not because of inclement weather but because they felt the Penn State baseball team had its game against Duquesne so well in hand that the eventual outcome would be the same whether they stayed to watch or not PERIOD

They were right PERIOD The three runs the Dukes managed to score in the top of the ninth inning had no influence on the result of the game which the Nittany Lions won  PERIOD

Penn State  Duquesne 

 right fielder Brian Ernst said PERIOD 

The Lions   Big Ten used the midweek nonconference game to give four different relief pitchers playing time by choice not because of unfavorable results PERIOD

Sophomore pitcher Seth Whitehill a member of the club baseball team last season who may see time in relief against Michigan State this weekend got the start and went two innings giving up two runs PERIOD Sophomore Paul Hawkins relieved him throwing three scoreless innings and earning the win to improve his record to  PERIOD With Penn State up  after five innings freshman Scott Kelley took the mound and pitched two innings giving up one run PERIOD Fellow freshman David Bumstead entered in the eighth with the Lions up  and closed out the game PERIOD

With the game in hand Penn State coach Robbie Wine began to replace the starting lineup  the same that started Sundays win against Iowa sans catcher James Spinelli  with bench players PERIOD Infielders Landon Nakata and Colin Runt played along with outfielders Rick Marlin and Ryan Boonie four players Wine had been looking to give playing time PERIOD

 Wine said PERIOD 

The Dukes   A10 meanwhile struggled with starting pitcher Brian Schwartzbauer  loading the bases in each of the first two innings PERIOD The Lions capitalized by scoring half of their  runs in the first two frames PERIOD

 Ernst said PERIOD 

Penn State cranked out  hits to earn its second straight Wednesday win of the season PERIOD Last Wednesday the Lions defeated Pittsburgh  in extrainnings PERIOD

 Wine said PERIOD
